subhead: After Friday's intense negotiations at the Assemblée Nationale, proposals to tax France's ultra-wealthy failed. PM Sébastien Lecornu announced further discussions with parliamentary groups.

title: Tanzania president wins landslide election victory after days of deadly protests
subhead: Samia Suluhu Hassan won 97.66% of the vote, the electoral commission announced on state television. The main opposition party, Chadema, says hundreds of people have been killed by security forces since protests broke out on election day on Wednesday.

title: Paris, an endless source of inspiration for perfumers
subhead: The world of fragrance has never stopped celebrating the French capital. Both historic houses and new brands continue to present their own olfactory interpretations of a city synonymous with style, freedom and refinement.

title: The unstoppable rise of Rheinmetall, Germany's tank and munitions giant
subhead: The arms company led by Armin Papperger has seen its share price soar since 2022. Through a flurry of acquisitions and partnerships, he aims to create a 'pan-European defense ecosystem' on land, sea, air and in space.

title: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.

title: Madagascar's new government faces scrutiny from Gen Z
subhead: President Michaël Randrianirina announced the 28 members of the government on Tuesday, October 28. Opposition leaders to the ousted regime, newcomers and technocrats now have 60 days to deliver results.

title: 'We're buying time, but we won't win the fight': Senegal's Saint-Louis faces the inexorable rise of the sea
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (3/6). Senegal's historic city will be largely underwater by the end of the 21st century. Several thousand fishermen have already left their homes on the beach for a stifling dormitory town.
